intro: Big moves in the AI industry this week. We combed through 25+ sources to surface what actually matters — here are the highlights.

articles.title: OpenAI policy exec who opposed chatbot’s “adult mode” reportedly fired on discrimination claim
articles.summary: The executive has denied the allegation that she engaged in discrimination.

articles.title: Facebook can animate your profile pic with AI
articles.summary: Facebook is rolling out new AI features that let you animate your profile picture and restyle Stories and Memories. You'll also be able to add animated backgrounds to text posts to make them pop in the feed. With the animated profile pictures, you'll be able to give a still photo motion with some preset types […].

articles.title: Claude Code costs up to $200 a month. Goose does the same thing for free.
articles.summary: The artificial intelligence coding revolution comes with a catch: it's expensive. Claude Code , Anthropic's terminal-based AI agent that can write, debug, and deploy code autonomously, has captured the imagination of software developers worldwide.

articles.title: RFK Jr. Says Americans Need More Protein. His Grok-Powered Food Website Disagrees
articles.summary: The site Realfood.gov uses Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot to dispense nutrition information—some of which contradicts the government’s new guidelines.

articles.title: Introducing SyGra Studio
articles.summary: Introducing SyGra Studio. Published on the Hugging Face blog covering open-source ML tools and models.

articles.title: Helping kids and teens learn and grow online on Safer Internet Day
articles.summary: User profile on smartphone connected to security, media, and settings icons.

articles.title: LangSmith is Now Available in Google Cloud Marketplace
articles.summary: Today, we're thrilled to announce that LangSmith, the agent engineering platform from LangChain, is available in Google Cloud Marketplace.

articles.title: GeForce NOW Celebrates Six Years of Streaming With 24 Games in February
articles.summary: Break out the cake and green sprinkles — GeForce NOW is turning six. Since launch, members have streamed over 1 billion hours, and the party’s just getting started. Throughout February, members can look forward to new games, fresh ways to play across more devices and even more ways to bring RTX power to every screen Read Article.

articles.title: ClawRouter
articles.summary: Smart LLM router — save 78% on inference costs. 30+ models, one wallet, x402 micropayments. (2,135 stars, 213 forks, TypeScript) Just 7 days old — gaining ~305 stars/day.

articles.title: Implementing the Snake Game in Python
articles.summary: An easy step-by-step guide to building the snake game from scratch.

articles.title: 629+ MCP Servers Exist. There Was No Directory. Until Now.
articles.summary: If you're building AI agents with the Model Context Protocol (MCP), you've probably hit this problem: You need a capability. You know someone built it. But you have no idea where to find it.

articles.title: Google AI Introduces Natively Adaptive Interfaces (NAI): An Agentic Multimodal Accessibility Framework Built on Gemini for Adaptive UI Design
articles.summary: Google Research is proposing a new way to build accessible software with Natively Adaptive Interfaces (NAI), an agentic framework where a multimodal AI agent becomes the primary user interface and adapts the application in real time to each user’s abilities and context.

articles.title: Uncertainty-Aware Multimodal Emotion Recognition through Dirichlet Parameterization
articles.authors: Remi Grzeczkowicz, Eric Soriano, Ali Janati et al.
articles.summary: In this work, we present a lightweight and privacy-preserving Multimodal Emotion Recognition (MER) framework designed for deployment on edge devices. To demonstrate framework's versatility, our implementation uses three modalities - speech, text and facial imagery.

articles.title: ONNX Based Generative AI LLMs in Java with Project Babylon by Adam Sotona [video]
articles.summary: ONNX Based Generative AI LLMs in Java with Project Babylon by Adam Sotona [video]. Published by Hacker News (AI).

articles.title: Shape, Symmetries, and Structure: The Changing Role of Mathematics in Machine Learning Research
articles.summary: What is the Role of Mathematics in Modern Machine Learning? The past decade has witnessed a shift in how progress is made in machine learning.
